docs.lead_paragraph: Physician-assisted suicide would be legal for terminally ill patients in California under a bill passed on Wednesday by a committee of the state Senate.

headline.main: California Bill That Would Allow Assisted Suicide Passes Senate Panel
headline.print_headline: California Bill That Would Allow Assisted Suicide Passes Senate Panel

docs.lead_paragraph: Arizona lawmakers approved legislation Wednesday that requires abortion providers to tell women they can reverse the effects of a drug-induced abortion and bars women from buying any health care plan through the federal marketplace that includes abortion coverage.

headline.main: Arizona Legislature OKs Abortion Medication Requirement

docs.lead_paragraph: The nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office estimated Wednesday that the bipartisan bill preventing cuts in doctors' fees for treating Medicare patients would total $214 billion in costs over the coming decade. Highlights of the CBO analysis (in rounded numbers):

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama said on Wednesday he was ready to sign bipartisan legislation to change the formula for reimbursing Medicare physicians, while the U.S. Senate's top Democrat appeared open to allowing a vote on the measure.

headline.main: Obama Ready to Sign Bipartisan Fix for Medicare Doctor Payments
headline.print_headline: Obama Ready to Sign Bipartisan Fix for Medicare Doctor Payments

headline.main: Readers Respond: On ‘Angelina Jolie Pitt: Diary of a Surgery’

docs.abstract: Ms. Jolie Pitt’s recent op-ed inspired gratitude, good wishes, and laments about the costs of health care.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama said Wednesday he's ready to sign "good, bipartisan" legislation protecting physicians from steep cuts in Medicare reimbursements and bolstering health programs for children and the poor as Senate Democrats seemed to soften their opposition to the package.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama spoke on Wednesday at a White House event on the fifth anniversary of the Affordable Care Act, saying that the law is saving both lives and money.

headline.main: Obama Hails Health Care Law Anniversary

docs.lead_paragraph: GOP presidential candidate Ted Cruz could soon be buying his family's health care coverage through the Affordable Care Act he has vowed to dismantle.

headline.main: Cruz Eyes Insurance via Obamacare, a Law He Vows to Scrap

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama said Wednesday that he's ready to sign good bipartisan legislation to fix Medicare's doctor payment problem, without endorsing any specific legislation.

headline.print_headline: Obama Says He's Ready to Sign Medicare Doctor Payment Fix

docs.lead_paragraph: New momentum for a lasting fix to Medicare's doctor-payment problem shows that lawmakers may finally be recognizing what has long bothered their constituents.
